import Mathlib

/-- Rudin exercise 5.3: If g : â„ â†’ â„ has bounded derivative |g'| â‰¤ M,
    then for small enough Îµ > 0 the map f(x) = x + Îµ g(x) is injective. -/
theorem Rudin_exercise_5_3 {g : â„ â†’ â„} (M : â„) (hder : âˆ€ x, |deriv g x| â‰¤ M) :
  âˆƒ Îµ0 > 0, âˆ€ Îµ, 0 < Îµ â†’ Îµ < Îµ0 â†’ Function.Injective (fun x => x + Îµ * g x) := by sorry
